quest.name: Kurobana vs. Gyorin
journal: Kurobana requires your help once more.

Kurobana has steadily been gaining the villagers' trust by continuing to pluck weeds and examine the local paddies. However, he is concerned that Namai would be defenseless should another creature attack. You tell Kurobana that Gyorin has been trying to sell some imperial weapons of late and agree to introduce him to the Namazu merchant.

Kurobana is impressed by Gyorin's wares and makes it clear he would like to buy them. Unfortunately, the Namazu merchant believes the guns to be worth quite a lotâ”€enough gil to live comfortably for a decade being his valuation. Shirojishi then appears claiming the village is under attack. While Kurobana has said he cannot afford to pay Gyorin's prices, Hayabusa asks if they can borrow the guns to protect Namai. You convince Gyorin to let the villagers take the guns and negotiate some form of payment later.
Gyorin, unsure as to whether he can trust the villagers, asks you to go with him to Namai. He wishes to collect his payment as soon as they have slain the creatures threatening their paddies.
Hayabusa cannot stop enthusing about how skillfully Kurobana slayed the two penghou with an imperial firearm. Gyorin then arrives on the scene, keen to get down to business.

Just as it is starting to look like the deal is not going to happen, a pile of nearby persimmons catches Gyorin's eye. He is all too eager to create a dye with them which he would use to make his own unique apron. Kurobana is somewhat confused by the merchant's thought process, but agrees to trade him one hundred persimmons in exchange for the imperial weaponry.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, how goes your journey?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I have been keeping myself busy plucking weeds and checking people's paddies. Slowly but surely I feel that the villagers are beginning to warm to me.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: However, there is one issue that has been worrying me of late: what to do if another beast appears seeking to harm our way of life. We can hardly continue relying on your aid.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: There are a few in the village that have experience fighting, but even they cannot do much without proper weapons. There is a limit to how effective farming tools can be in battle.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: A Namazu that sells imperial weapons? Hmm, that could be worth investigating.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Would you be so kind as to introduce us? I shall bring Hayabusa along as well. You said the Namazu lives in Yuzuka Manor, yes? We will meet you there.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: You said the Namazu lives in Yuzuka Manor, yes? Hayabusa and I will meet you there.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Why, Forename. To what do I owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: I am most definitely still in possession of the weapons, yes, yes. I put them in storage as no one seemed even slightly interested in purchasing them.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: I tried selling them in Doma, but my efforts were met with great displeasure. They said my actions insulted their honor, that they never wanted to see imperial weapons again.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Even Gyofu has attested to the quality of the weaponry. No, no, I do not know why I struggle to sell them.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I had heard rumors of this place, but I never imagined there were so many Namazu living here.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Welcome, valued guests! Could I interest you in any of my wares?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: We are searching for a Namazu selling imperial weapons.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Well, you are in luck for that is me! I shall bring the goods to you right this moment.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Imperial guns... Even those in Namai that cannot handle a spear or a sword may be able to use these.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Indeed, indeed! You seem like a Lupin who knows a bargain when he sees one.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: We will take them. Name your price.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Enough gil to live comfortably for a decade or so should suffice.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Have you lost your mind!?

dialogue.name: SHIROJISHI
dialogue.text: Kurobana, Hayabusa, the village is in trouble!

dialogue.name: SHIROJISHI
dialogue.text: More of those creatures have appeared and they're ruining our paddies!

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: May we borrow these weapons first and negotiate payment later? The village cannot wait!

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: I do hope you are not trying to trick me.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We'll pay you later!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We need to try before we buy!

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: You speak the truth, yes, yes?

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: But of course! If you use them first, you can admire their qualities and be convinced to purchase them. You are a fine merchant, Forename!

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: If you are friends of Forename then you have my trust. I will receive payment once you are done!

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: My thanks. Let us hurry back to the village!

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Please make sure they do pay me. I only lent them the weapons because you introduced them to me.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: In fact, let us both go to Namai to make certain that this deal reaches a satisfactory conclusion.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Did I truly just do that?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Ah, adventurer! You will not believe this.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Our very own Kurobana slayed these foul beasts.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: He is truly a natural with a rifle. It was as if I was watching a veteran hunter!

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: I am sure he is good enough to protect the village if he is equipped with the right gun. In time, he may even become just as effective as his brother!

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: My instincts took control of me... I'm honestly not entirely sure what I just did.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: But perhaps you are right. With practice, I might be able to fill the role my brother used to serve.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Wh-What are these creatures!?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Ah, merchant. Your weapons were exactly what we needed. The penghou never stood a chance.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: I am most glad to hear that you found my wares to your liking.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Now, now, let us talk business by the Tenkonto.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I asked Fukudo to join us to help haggle with your merchant friend. I do hope we are able to get the weapons for a fair price. They may be my only hope of living up to my brother's legacy.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: With the right weapon, Kurobana may prove to be just as capable as Hakuro in a fight.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: You were saying that you cannot give me enough gil to live on for ten years, yes, yes?

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: In that case, why don't you try offering me something else of equal value?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I fear that we may struggle to find anything you would consider to be worth that much in Namai...

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: I risked my life to obtain these guns. It is only fair I receive something substantial for them.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Could you allow us some time to think?

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: If that is truly what you require.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: But pray tell me, just what are those?

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Well, they are persimmons. Are you not familiar with the fruit?

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: If I were to use those to make an orange dye I could create a magnificent apron that is mine and mine alone!

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: How about you trade me one hundred persimmons for the weapons?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Is that truly enough for you?

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! Do you agree to my proposal?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Well, yes. I suppose we do.

dialogue.name: GYORIN
dialogue.text: Forename, thank you oh so very very much! These people have given me something of great value and it was you who introduced them to me!
